title: Massachusetts Firm Recalls Chili Products Produced Without Benefit of Inspection
summary: WASHINGTON, Feb. 16, 2012 - The Chili Station, a Ludlow, Mass. establishment, is recalling approximately 3,800 pounds of chili products because they may have been produced without the benefit of federal inspection, the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today...
impacted_products: 5 gallon containers and 1-gallon bags of "The Chili Station" Beef Chili with Beans
5 gallon containers and 1-gallon of "The Chili Station" Beef Chili with Beans and/or Turkey Chili
